resources.string: Tap and hold a set to select it.\n\nYou can tap multiple sets to select more than one.
Once you have selected sets, you can either go through the cards of your selected sets the way they are…
…or play them with the other side up first.
You can either go through your cards the way they are…
…or play them with the other side up first.
You currently have no cards. Click the + button in the toolbar to add a new card!
"You're now in your new set called \"%s\", but it's empty!\n\nClick the + button in the toolbar to add a new card!"
You currently have no sets. Click the + button in the toolbar to add a new set!

Required fields:

frontText - Text
backText - Text

Optional fields: 

setId - Number
setName - Text
cardId - Number
currentInterval - {STAGE_1, STAGE_2, STAGE_3, STAGE_4, STAGE_5, DONE}
nextRecheck - Date_Milliseconds
checkCount - Number
positiveCheckCount - Number
Feedback?\n\nOpen an issue on my github page.
Do you really want to delete this set?
Do you really want to delete this card?
There are no cards to rehearse today!

Spaced Repetition is a learning technique, where new flashcards are rehearsed more frequently.
If you remembered correctly, the interval on when the card comes up next will increase, otherwise the interval will be reset to 1 day.

Wikipedia has a more detailed explanation.
Allow Easy Flashcards to collect crash- & usage-data. <b>NO personal data is collected!<b>
Limit cards to rehearse per sitting
Amount of cards to rehearse per sitting:
Warning!\n\nIf you delete this set, all associated cards will be deleted as well!
Do not rehearse terms that you have already remembered
Terms that have been correctly rehearsed often enough will no longer show up.
An error occurred during the import, the following required columnheaders were not supplied:\n\n%s
Oops, something went wrong! The following error occurred: \n\n%s
